content.body: Domenic: thanks for the SAB review. I'll try to understand that type nuance a bit better. Are you are the existing typedefs work though? It seems they would not allow for resizable or shared buffers in a number of places, for instance.
content.formatted_body: Domenic: thanks for the SAB review. I'll try to understand that type nuance a bit better. Are you are the existing typedefs work though? It seems they would not allow for resizable or shared buffers in a number of places, for instance.

content.body: annevk: yeah the existing typedefs might not work well. It's more that using "an `X` object" or "an `X`" where `X` is an IDL typedef is known-good phrasing.
content.formatted_body: annevk: yeah the existing typedefs might not work well. It's more that using "an X object" or "an X" where X is an IDL typedef is known-good phrasing.
